revision.comment: Reverted 3 edits by [[Special:Contributions/81.154.62.16|81.154.62.16]] ([[User talk:81.154.62.16|talk]]) to last revision by Keith D ([[WP:TW|TW]])
revision.text:
{{Use British English|date=February 2019}} {{Use dmy dates|date=February 2019}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Jordan Henderson | image = FWC 2018 - Round of 16 - COL v ENG - J Henderson.jpg | image_size = 200 | caption = Henderson playing for [[England national football team|England]] at the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]] | fullname = Jordan Brian Henderson<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/612828 |title=Updated squads for 2017/18 Premier League confirmed |publisher=Premier League |date=2 February 2018 |accessdate=11 February 2018}}</ref> | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1990|6|17|df=y}}<ref>{{cite web |url=https://tournament.fifadata.com/documents/FWC/2018/pdf/FWC_2018_SQUADLISTS.PDF |title=FIFA World Cup Russia 2018: List of players: England |publisher=FIFA |format=PDF |page=10 |date=15 July 2018 |accessdate=12 October 2018}}</ref> | birth_place = [[Sunderland]], England | height = {{convert|1.82|m|order=flip}}<ref>{{cite web |url=https://uk.soccerway.com/players/jordan-henderson/48010/ |title=J. Henderson: Summary |website=Soccerway |publisher=Perform Group |accessdate=15 November 2018}}</ref> | position = [[Midfielder]] | currentclub = [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] | clubnumber = 14 | youthyears1 = 1998–2008 | youthclubs1 = [[Sunderland A.F.C. Reserves and Academy|Sunderland]] | years1 = 2008–2011 | clubs1 = [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]] | caps1 = 71 | goals1 = 4 | years2 = 2009 | clubs2 = → [[Coventry City F.C.|Coventry City]] (loan) | caps2 = 10 | goals2 = 1 | years3 = 2011– | clubs3 = [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] | caps3 = 228 | goals3 = 21 | nationalyears1 = 2009 | nationalteam1 = [[England national under-19 football team|England U19]] | nationalcaps1 = 1 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 = 2009 | nationalteam2 = [[England national under-20 football team|England U20]] | nationalcaps2 = 1 | nationalgoals2 = 0 | nationalyears3 = 2010–2013 | nationalteam3 = [[England national under-21 football team|England U21]] | nationalcaps3 = 27 | nationalgoals3 = 4 | nationalyears4 = 2010– | nationalteam4 = [[England national football team|England]] | nationalcaps4 = 48 | nationalgoals4 = 0 | club-update = 19:27, 12 February 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 19:27, 12 February 2019 (UTC) }} '''Jordan Brian Henderson''' (born 17 June 1990) is an English professional [[Association football|footballer]] who [[Captain (association football)|captains]] {{English football updater|Liverpoo}} club [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] and plays for the [[England national football team|English national team]]. He is usually deployed as a [[Midfielder#Central midfielder|central midfielder]] for both club and country.
Henderson began his career at [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]] in 2008, with a [[Loan (sports)|loan]] spell at [[Coventry City F.C.|Coventry City]] in 2009, before moving to Liverpool in 2011. He became captain of Liverpool in 2015 following the departure of [[Steven Gerrard]]. In 2010, Henderson won his first [[Cap (sport)|cap]] for England, having previously played for and captained the [[England national under-21 football team|under-21 team]]. He has represented the country at [[UEFA Euro 2012]] and [[UEFA Euro 2016|2016]], and the [[2014 FIFA World Cup|2014]] and [[2018 FIFA World Cup]]s.
==Club career== ===Sunderland=== Henderson was born in [[Sunderland]], Tyne and Wear<ref name=Hugman1011>{{cite book |editor-first=Barry J. |editor-last=Hugman |title=The PFA Footballers' Who's Who 2010–11 |year=2010 |publisher=Mainstream Publishing |location=Edinburgh |isbn=978-1-84596-601-0 |page=194}}</ref> and joined the youth system of his hometown club [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]] aged eight.<ref>{{cite web |first=Sam |last=Lightle |title=The rise of Jordan Henderson |url=http://www.safc.com/news/features/2016/february/jordan-henderson-feature |publisher=Sunderland A.F.C. |date=4 February 2016 |accessdate=26 March 2016}}</ref> He signed a professional contract with the club on 1 July 2008.<ref name=Hugman1011/> He played his first league match for Sunderland as a half-time [[Substitute (association football)|substitute]] on 1 November 2008 in a 5–0 away defeat to [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]].<ref>{{cite news |date=1 November 2008 |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/match_report/0,19762,11065_3003690,00.html |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20120525153838/http://www.skysports.com/football/match_report/0,19762,11065_3003690,00.html |deadurl=yes |archivedate=25 May 2012 |title=Blues batter Black Cats |publisher=Sky Sports |accessdate=1 November 2008}}</ref> He then made his first Sunderland start and home debut against [[Blackburn Rovers F.C.|Blackburn Rovers]] in the [[2008–09 Football League Cup|League Cup]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/league_cup/7708817.stm |title=Sunderland 1–2 Blackburn |date=18 December 2008 |accessdate=18 December 2008 |first=Andrew |last=McKenzie |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref>
====Coventry City (loan)==== In January 2009, Henderson joined [[EFL Championship|Championship]] club [[Coventry City F.C.|Coventry City]] on a one-month [[Loan (sports)|loan]] deal.<ref>{{cite news |date=29 January 2009 |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/c/coventry_city/7858023.stm |title=Coventry sign Henderson on loan |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=29 January 2009}}</ref> He made his Coventry debut in a 2–1 defeat to [[Derby County F.C.|Derby County]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_div_1/7856665.stm |title=Derby 2–1 Coventry |date=31 January 2009 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=31 January 2009}}</ref> Henderson's loan to Coventry was extended until the end of the season,<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/c/coventry_city/7905188.stm |title=Henderson to extend Coventry loan |date=23 February 2009 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=13 February 2009}}</ref> and he scored the first senior goal of his career on 28 February 2009 against [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich City]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_div_1/7899696.stm |title=Norwich 1–2 Coventry |publisher=BBC Sport |date=28 February 2009 |accessdate=20 December 2009}}</ref> After picking up an injury, a fracture to the [[fifth metatarsal bone]] in his foot, he returned to Sunderland in April 2009.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.safc.com/news/henderson-back-at-sunderland.html |title=Henderson back at Sunderland |date=8 April 2009 |publisher=Sunderland A.F.C. |accessdate=8 April 2009 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090410224631/http://www.safc.com/news/henderson-back-at-sunderland.html |archivedate=10 April 2009 }}</ref>
====Return to Sunderland==== [[File:Jordan Henderson.jpg|thumb|left|upright|Henderson playing for [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]] in 2011]]
In the [[2009–10 Sunderland A.F.C. season|2009–10 season]], Henderson broke into the Sunderland first team and made several [[2009–10 Premier League|Premier League]] appearances.{{citation needed|date=April 2016}} He scored his first senior goal for the club against [[Birmingham City F.C.|Birmingham City]] in the [[2009–10 Football League Cup|League Cup]] third round.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/league_cup/8256923.stm |title=Sunderland 2–0 Birmingham |publisher=BBC Sport |date=22 September 2009 |accessdate=26 September 2009}}</ref> He then went on to score his first Premier League goal against [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] on 19 December 2009.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/8414079.stm |title=Man City 4–3 Sunderland |publisher=BBC Sport |date=19 December 2009 |accessdate=20 December 2009}}</ref>
Henderson spent the majority of the season on the right side of midfield but played centrally in the absence of [[Lee Cattermole]]; his versatility and consistency earning him a new five-year contract on 23 April 2010, keeping him with the club until 2015.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.safc.com/news/20100424/young-pair-sign-new-deals_2256213_2033419 |title=Young pair sign new deals |publisher=Sunderland A.F.C. |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100831145835/http://www.safc.com/news/20100424/young-pair-sign-new-deals_2256213_2033419 |archivedate=31 August 2010}}</ref> He also went on to win the Sunderland Young Player of the Year award for the 2009–10 season.<ref name=poy10>{{cite news |url=http://www.jarrowandhebburngazette.com/latest-sport/Bent-is-fans39-player-of.6239082.jp |title=Jordan Wins Player of the Year |newspaper=Jarrow & Hebburn Gazette}}</ref>
On 13 January 2011, Henderson was listed on the official FIFA website as one of 13 young players to watch in 2011.<ref>{{cite web |date=13 January 2011 |url=https://www.fifa.com/worldfootball/clubfootball/news/newsid=1363573.html |publisher=FIFA |title=Players to watch in 2011}}</ref> He was named Sunderland's Young Player of the Year for the second season running.<ref name=poy11>{{cite web |url=http://www.safc.com/news/20110518/bardsley-secures-awards-double_2256213_2362723 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110811200341/http://www.safc.com/news/20110518/bardsley-secures-awards-double_2256213_2362723 |archivedate=11 August 2011 |date=18 May 2011 |publisher=Sunderland A.F.C. |title=Bardsley secures awards double}}</ref>
===Liverpool=== [[File:Jordan Henderson Liverpool vs Bolton 2011.jpg|thumb|upright|Henderson playing for [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] in 2011]]
On 9 June 2011, Henderson was transferred to [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] for an undisclosed fee, thought to be between £16 and £20 million.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/latest-news/reds-agree-henderson-deal |title=Reds agree Henderson deal |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141013003601/http://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/latest-news/reds-agree-henderson-deal |archivedate=13 October 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2011/jun/13/jordan-henderson-liverpool |location=London |newspaper=The Guardian |first=Paul |last=Doyle |title=Jordan Henderson aims to reward Liverpool's faith and £20m investment |date=13 June 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/liverpool/8562999/Liverpool-and-Sunderland-agree-transfer-fee-for-Jordan-Henderson.html |location=London |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |title=Liverpool and Sunderland agree transfer fee for Jordan Henderson |date=8 June 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/liverpool-fc/liverpool-fc-news/2011/06/10/liverpool-fc-s-jordan-henderson-on-his-transfer-to-anfield-and-his-dreams-for-the-future-100252-28853814/ |newspaper=Liverpool Echo |first=Neil |last=Jones |title=Liverpool FC's Jordan Henderson on his transfer to Anfield and his dreams for the future |date=10 June 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.liverpoolfc.tv/news/latest-news/lfc-complete-henderson-deal |title=Jordan Henderson completes Liverpool move |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110612131150/http://www.liverpoolfc.tv/news/latest-news/lfc-complete-henderson-deal |archivedate=12 June 2011 }}</ref><ref name="Liverpool complete Jordan Henderson deal">{{cite news |title=Liverpool complete Jordan Henderson deal |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/13685517.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=9 June 2011 |accessdate=9 June 2011}}</ref> He made his debut in Liverpool's first match of the [[2011–12 Premier League]], a 1–1 draw against his former club Sunderland where he was given a mixed reception by Sunderland fans.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/competitions/premier-league/8695430/Liverpool-1-Sunderland-1-match-report.html |title=Liverpool 1 Sunderland 1 |date=13 August 2011 |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |accessdate=16 August 2011 |location=London |first=Rory |last=Smith}}</ref> On 27 August 2011, Henderson scored his first goal for Liverpool in a Premier League fixture at [[Anfield]] against [[Bolton Wanderers F.C.|Bolton Wanderers]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/report/_/id/318272?cc=5739 |title=Rampant Reds beat Bolton |website=ESPN Soccernet |date=27 August 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121102064729/http://soccernet.espn.go.com/report/_/id/318272?cc=5739 |archivedate=2 November 2012 |deadurl=yes}}</ref> On 26 February 2012, Henderson started on the right of midfield in Liverpool's [[2012 Football League Cup Final|2012 League Cup Final]] victory over [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] before being substituted in the 58th minute.<ref name=2012LC>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/17093419 |title=Cardiff 2–2 Liverpool |first=Chris |last=Bevan |publisher=BBC Sport |date=26 February 2012 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160125212506/https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/17093419 |archivedate=25 January 2016}}</ref> On 5 May, he played the full 90 minutes as Liverpool were beaten 2–1 by Chelsea in the [[2012 FA Cup Final]].<ref name=2012FAC>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/17878435 |title=Chelsea 2–1 Liverpool |first=Phil |last=McNulty |publisher=BBC Sport |date=5 May 2012 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160118044832/https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/17878435 |archivedate=18 January 2016}}</ref> Henderson ended the [[2011–12 Liverpool F.C. season|2011–12 season]] with two goals from 44 appearances.<ref name=sb1112/>
In August 2012, Henderson was told he would be allowed to join [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] by new manager [[Brendan Rodgers]], but this was rejected by the player.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/liverpool/9662510/Liverpools-Jordan-Henderson-was-shocked-to-be-told-he-could-leave-Anfield.html |title=Liverpool's Jordan Henderson was shocked to be told he could leave Anfield |date=7 November 2012 |accessdate=16 April 2014 |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London}}</ref> He went on to score his first [[Liverpool F.C. in European football|European]] goal for Liverpool on 6 December 2012, with the winner against [[Udinese Calcio|Udinese]] in the [[2012–13 UEFA Europa League|UEFA Europa League]] as the ''Reds'' qualified for the last 32.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/competitions/europa-league/9727494/Udinese-0-Liverpool-1-match-report.html# |title=Udinese 0 Liverpool 1 |date=6 December 2012 |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |accessdate=7 December 2012}}</ref>
Henderson established himself as a regular member of the Liverpool team in the [[2013–14 Liverpool F.C. season|2013–14 season]], playing in 35 [[2013–14 Premier League|Premier League]] matches before he received his first career [[Ejection (sports)|red card]] in a 3–2 win over Manchester City on 13 April 2014, resulting in an automatic three match ban which meant he would miss three of Liverpool's last four matches.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/analysis-how-liverpool-fc-cope-6987457 |title=Reds analysis: how will Brendan Rodgers cope without Jordan Henderson? |date=14 April 2014 |accessdate=16 April 2014 |newspaper=Liverpool Echo}}</ref> On 29 September, he made his 100th appearance for the club as Liverpool won 1–3 at Sunderland.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/jordan-henderson-marks-100th-liverpool-2323247 |title=Jordan Henderson marks 100th Liverpool appearance with unusual landmark in win over Sunderland |accessdate=16 April 2014 |newspaper=Daily Mirror |location=London}}</ref>
[[File:Jordan Henderson 20141221 (cropped).jpg|thumb|left|upright|Henderson playing for Liverpool in 2014]]
Henderson started the season in good form, providing two assists in Liverpool's first three league matches,<ref>{{cite web |title=Jordan Henderson's Profile |url=http://www.whoscored.com/Players/68659/Show/Jordan-Henderson |publisher=whoscored.com |accessdate=4 October 2014}}</ref> and was named as the club's vice-captain following the departure of [[Daniel Agger]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/latest-news/170805-henderson-confirmed-as-new-vice-captain |title=Henderson confirmed as new vice-captain |publisher=Liverpool F.C.}}</ref> On 29 November, Henderson started as the captain for the first time for Liverpool in the Premier League against [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]] as [[Steven Gerrard]] stayed on the bench.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30156814 |title=Liverpool 1–0 Stoke City |author=McNulty, Phil |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> On 2 December, Henderson marked his 150th appearance for the club by scoring the third goal in a 3–1 win against [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]] to confirm the win.<ref>https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/30188283</ref> Henderson started many Liverpool matches as captain as Gerrard was out injured or being rested on the bench.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2015/mar/01/liverpool-manchester-city-premier-league-match-report |title=Liverpool's Philippe Coutinho deals body blow to Manchester City hopes |date=1 March 2015 |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/31616985 |title=Liverpool 2–0 Burnley |date=4 March 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=6 March 2015}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/31792005 |title=Swansea City 0–1 Liverpool |publisher=BBC Sport |date=16 March 2015 |accessdate=17 March 2015}}</ref> On 23 April, Henderson signed a five-year contract extension at Liverpool worth £100,000 a week.<ref>{{cite news |title=Liverpool's Jordan Henderson signs new five-year deal |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/32431692 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=23 April 2015}}</ref>
Following the departure of Steven Gerrard in June 2015, Henderson was made captain of Liverpool.<ref>{{cite web |title=Henderson appointed new Liverpool Captain |url=http://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/latest-news/188441-henderson-appointed-liverpool-captain |publisher=Liverpool F.C. |date=10 July 2015 |accessdate=10 July 2015}}</ref> After aggravating a heel injury Henderson underwent surgery,<ref>{{cite news |title=Liverpool 1–0 Bournemouth |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33843979 |accessdate=20 September 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=17 August 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |first=Mike |last=Whalley |title=Liverpool midfielder Jordan Henderson has treatment on heel injury |url=http://www.espn.co.uk/football/liverpool/story/2615133/jordan-henderson-has-treatment-on-heel-injury |publisher=ESPN |date=16 September 2015 |accessdate=20 December 2017}}</ref> but broke a bone in his right foot before he could rejoin the starting line-up.<ref>{{cite web |title=Jordan Henderson ruled out for Liverpool with broken foot – reports |url=http://www.espn.co.uk/football/liverpool/story/2619955/jordan-henderson-ruled-out-for-liverpool-with-broken-foot |publisher=ESPN |date=19 September 2015 |accessdate=20 December 2017}}</ref> It was reported that Henderson's heel problems stemmed from the incurable condition [[plantar fasciitis]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11669/10089575/jordan-henderson-reveals-heel-injury-has-no-cure |title=Jordan Henderson reveals heel injury 'has no cure' |author=Turner, Stephen |publisher=Sky Sports |accessdate=31 December 2015}}</ref>
Henderson started the 2016–17 season with regular appearance in the starting eleven and on 16 September scored a spectacular 25-yard strike in a 2–1 win over Chelsea at [[Stamford Bridge (stadium)|Stamford Bridge]].<ref>{{cite news |last=McNulty |first=Phil |title=Chelsea 2–1 Liverpool |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/37314772 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=19 September 2016 |date=16 September 2016}}</ref> The strike earned him the [[Premier League Goal of the Month]] award for the month of September.<ref name=goalofmonth>{{cite news |last=Prentice |first=David |url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/screamer-liverpools-jordan-henderson-wins-11969907 |title=Liverpool's Jordan Henderson wins September Goal of the Month |newspaper=Liverpool Echo |date=3 October 2016 |accessdate=5 December 2017}}</ref>
Henderson signed a new five-year deal at Liverpool in 2018 after leading the club to its first UEFA Champions League final in over a decade.<ref>{{cite news |title=Jordan Henderson signs new long-term LFC contract |url=https://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/first-team/314962-jordan-henderson-new-liverpool-contract |publisher=Liverpool FC |date=3 September 2018 |accessdate=3 September 2018}}</ref> After signing the contract, Henderson emphasised his intentions to remain at Liverpool for as long as possible and ideally the remainder of his career.<ref>{{cite news |title=Henderson: I'll dedicate my life to bring LFC success |url=https://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/first-team/315012-jordan-henderson-liverpool-contract-interview |publisher=Liverpool FC |date=3 September 2018 |accessdate=3 September 2018}}</ref> On 24 November, Henderson was sent off after receiving a second yellow card in a 3–0 win against [[Watford_F.C.|Watford]], meaning he would miss the [[Merseyside derby]] on 2 December.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.skysports.com/football/news/11669/11561999/jurgen-klopp-says-he-was-going-to-sub-jordan-henderson-before-his-red-card |title=Jurgen Klopp says he was going to sub Jordan Henderson before his red card |publisher=Sky Sports |date=24 November 2018 |accessdate=23 November 2018}}</ref>
==International career== [[File:Henderson Captaining ENG-U-21.jpg|thumb|upright|Henderson playing for [[England national under-21 football team|England U21s]] in 2012]]
===Youth=== Henderson has represented England at four levels. He made his debut for the [[England national under-19 football team|under-19s]] against the [[Czech Republic national under-19 football team|Czech Republic]] in 2009, before breaking into [[Stuart Pearce]]'s [[England national under-21 football team|under-21]] squad. He scored his first goal in an England shirt in the [[2011 UEFA European Under-21 Championship qualification|European U21 Championship play-offs]] against [[Romania national under-21 football team|Romania]], hitting a volley from outside the box to give England the lead.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.thefa.com/England/All-Teams/Players/H/Jordan-Henderson |title=Jordan Henderson |publisher=The Football Association |accessdate=3 March 2014}}</ref>
Henderson was selected in the England U21 squad for the [[2011 UEFA European Under-21 Championship|2011 European Championships]]. However, England were knocked out in the group stage.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.mirrorfootball.co.uk/news/Sunderland-England-news-Jordan-Henderson-dismisses-burnout-fears-ahead-of-Under-21-European-Championship-article743270.html |title=Sunderland England news Jordan Henderson dismisses burnout fears ahead of Under-21 European Championship |newspaper=Daily Mirror |location=London |date=31 May 2011 |accessdate=3 March 2014}}</ref> He [[Captain (association football)|captained]] the England U21 team in a 6–0 win over [[Azerbaijan national football team U-21|Azerbaijan U21]] on 1 September 2011, scoring one goal in the [[2013 UEFA European Under-21 Championship qualification|Euro 2013 qualifier]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/14656731.stm |title=England U21 6–0 Azerbaijan U21 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=1 September 2011 |accessdate=15 January 2012}}</ref> He then scored his fourth under-21 goal in a 2–1 win away at [[Norway national under-21 football team|Norway]], maintaining England's 100% record in Euro 2013 qualification.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/15249955.stm |title=Norway U21 1–2 England U21 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=10 October 2011 |accessdate=15 January 2012}}</ref> On 3 February 2013, Henderson was named the [[England Player of the Year#England Men’s U21 Player of the Year|England U21 Player of the Year]] in the inaugural year of the award.<ref name=u21p>{{cite web |url=http://www.thefa.com/News/2013/feb/mens-england-u21s-award-030213.aspx |title=Jordan scoops U21s gong |publisher=The Football Association |date=3 February 2013 |accessdate=3 February 2013}}</ref> He captained the under-21 team at the [[2013 UEFA European Under-21 Championship]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.thefa.com/england/mens-under-21s/News/2013/england-euro-2013-squad |title=England U21s Squad |publisher=The Football Association |date=14 May 2013 |accessdate=9 June 2013}}</ref>
===Senior=== On 11 November 2010, Henderson was omitted from England's U21 squad for their friendly with [[Germany national under-21 football team|Germany]],<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2010/nov/11/jordan-henderson-england-call-up |location=London |newspaper=The Guardian |first=Louise |last=Taylor |title=Sunderland's Jordan Henderson poised for first England call-up |date=11 November 2010}}</ref> instead receiving his first call up to the senior England squad on 17 November 2010 for their friendly against [[France national football team|France]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/9194622.stm|title=England 1-2 France|date=17 November 2010|accessdate=24 February 2019|via=news.bbc.co.uk}}</ref> He made his debut in the match, playing from the start in central midfield alongside Steven Gerrard.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/england/8140711/England-1-France-2-match-report.html |title=England 1 France 2 |date=17 November 2010 |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |accessdate=22 November 2010 |location=London |first=Henry |last=Winter}}</ref>
Initially named as a standby player,<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/18081125 |title=England Euro 2012 squad: Ruddy, Carroll & Defoe in, Ferdinand out |publisher=BBC Sport |date=16 May 2012 |accessdate=30 May 2012}}</ref> Henderson was called up to the England Euro 2012 squad to replace the injured [[Frank Lampard]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/18265377 |title=Euro 2012: England's Frank Lampard ruled out through injury |publisher=BBC Sport |date=31 May 2012 |accessdate=31 May 2012}}</ref> He featured in England's first match of the tournament against France, coming on as a late substitute for [[Scott Parker]],<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/18076341 |title=Euro 2012: France 1–1 England |first=Phil |last=McNulty |publisher=BBC Sport |date=11 June 2012 |accessdate=11 June 2012}}</ref> and again featured as a substitute, coming on during extra-time, in England's [[UEFA Euro 2012 knockout stage|quarter-final]] [[Penalty shoot-out (association football)|penalty shoot-out]] defeat to [[Italy national football team|Italy]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/18355305 |title=Euro 2012: England 0–0 Italy |first=Phil |last=McNulty |publisher=BBC Sport |date=24 June 2012 |accessdate=16 October 2012}}</ref>
Henderson was selected in Roy Hodgson's 23-man squad to travel to Brazil for the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/may/12/england-world-cup-squad-hodgson-barkley-sterling |title=England World Cup squad 2014: Ross Barkley and Raheem Sterling called up |date=12 May 2014 |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |accessdate=14 May 2014}}</ref> He started in England's opening two World Cup group matches, 2–1 losses to [[Italy national football team|Italy]] in [[Manaus]] and to [[Uruguay national football team|Uruguay]] in São Paulo.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/25285071 |title=World Cup: England 1–2 Italy |date=14 June 2014 |accessdate=8 September 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/25285176 |title=World Cup 2014: Uruguay 2–1 England |date=19 June 2014 |accessdate=8 September 2018}}</ref>
Henderson also went to Euro 2016 with Roy Hodgson in France.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/may/16/england-euro-2016-squad-23-picked-roy-hodgson |title=England's Euro 2016 squad: the 23 picked by Roy Hodgson |date=31 May 2016 |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London}}</ref> He only played one match, that being the final group match against [[Slovakia national football team|Slovakia]] which ended 0–0 as England finished second in their group.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/live/2016/jun/20/slovakia-v-england-euro-2016-live |title=England come second as Roy Hodgson's gamble backfires in Slovakia stalemate |date=20 June 2016 |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London}}</ref>
He was named in the 23-man [[England national football team|England national team]] squad for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44138600 |title=England World Cup squad: Trent Alexander-Arnold in 23-man squad |publisher=BBC Sport |date=16 May 2018 |accessdate=17 May 2018}}</ref> In England's Round of 16 match against [[Colombia national football team|Colombia]], Henderson was the only Three Lions player to miss a spot-kick as the match went to penalties. England still won though, 4–3, and made it to the semi-finals.<ref>https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44610244</ref>
==Style of play== Henderson plays as a [[Midfielder#Box-to-box midfielder|box-to-box midfielder]]<ref>{{cite web |title=Jordan Henderson |url=http://www.liverpoolfc.com/team/first-team/player/jordan-henderson |publisher=Liverpool F.C. |accessdate=28 May 2016}}</ref> although under [[Jürgen Klopp]], he has mostly been used as a [[Midfielder#Defensive midfielder|defensive midfielder]]<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.espn.in/football/club/liverpool/364/blog/post/3282423/jordan-henderson-the-scapegoat-but-liverpool-defensive-issues-run-deeper |title=Cox: Henderson blame too easy at Liverpool |publisher=ESPN |accessdate=1 June 2018}}</ref>. He is widely regarded as a player who works hard and brings energy to the team.<ref>{{cite news |title=Liverpool missed Jordan Henderson and Daniel Sturridge against Chelsea |url=http://metro.co.uk/2014/04/28/liverpool-missed-jordan-henderson-and-daniel-sturridge-against-chelsea-4711035/ |newspaper=Metro |location=London |accessdate=24 February 2015}}</ref> Described as an "athletic and hardworking midfielder," Henderson has developed his game during his time at Liverpool into a more creative player.<ref>{{cite web |title=The Improvement of Jordan Henderson: Stats Analysis |url=http://eplindex.com/47401/improvement-jordan-henderson-stats-analysis.html |publisher=EPL Index |accessdate=24 February 2015}}</ref> Furthermore, he constantly presses high up the field whenever the opposition is in possession.<ref name=auto>{{cite web |last1=Ladson |first1=Matt |title=Complete Analysis of Jordan Henderson's Liverpool Role |url=http://bleacherreport.com/articles/2015360-complete-analysis-of-jordan-hendersons-liverpool-role |publisher=Bleacher Report |accessdate=24 February 2015}}</ref>
==Personal life== Henderson was schooled at [[Farringdon Community Sports College]] before joining Sunderland as a youngster.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/blog/2010/nov/14/jordan-henderson-sunderland-england-call |title=Jordan Henderson: Sunderland's hidden treasure steps into the limelight |date=14 November 2010 |first=Louise |last=Taylor |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London}}</ref> He is a Sunderland fan and was spotted at the [[2014 Football League Cup Final|2014 League Cup Final]] with the Sunderland fans, whilst being a player at Liverpool.<ref>{{cite news |first=Dave |last=Kidd |title=Liverpool's Jordan Henderson pays tribute to Sunderland and reveals he watched their Wembley defeat from the stands |url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/liverpools-jordan-henderson-pays-tribute-3221634 |newspaper=Daily Mirror |location=London |date=8 March 2014 |accessdate=26 March 2016}}</ref> On the same day as being named Liverpool captain, it was announced he would also be featuring alongside [[Lionel Messi]] on the cover of the UK edition of ''[[FIFA 16]]''.<ref>{{cite web |title=Jordan Henderson is the FIFA 16 cover star in the UK |url=http://www.fifplay.com/fifa16-cover-uk/ |publisher=FIFPlay |accessdate=10 July 2015}}</ref>

==Honours== '''Liverpool''' *[[Football League Cup]]: [[2011–12 Football League Cup|2011–12]];<ref name=2012LC/> runner-up: [[2015–16 Football League Cup|2015–16]]<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35624164 |title=Liverpool 1–1 Manchester City |first=Phil |last=McNulty |publisher=BBC Sport |date=28 February 2016 |accessdate=20 December 2017}}</ref> *[[FA Cup]] runner-up: [[2011–12 FA Cup|2011–12]]<ref name=2012FAC/> *[[UEFA Europa League]] runner-up: [[2015–16 UEFA Europa League|2015–16]]<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36254631 |title=Liverpool 1–3 Sevilla |first=Phil |last=McNulty |publisher=BBC Sport |date=18 May 2016 |accessdate=20 December 2017}}</ref> *[[UEFA Champions League]] runner-up: [[2017–18 UEFA Champions League|2017–18]]<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44258022 |title=Real Madrid 3–1 Liverpool |first=Phil |last=McNulty |publisher=BBC Sport |date=26 May 2018 |accessdate=27 May 2018}}</ref>
